medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noticed dryness and flaking of his scalp at the age of 10 years. He subsequently developed sores on the scalp that resulted in permanent hair loss. The symptoms have progressed over time, with topical and systemic treatments proving unsuccessful. Isotretinoin treatment at age 17 resulted in a flare of scalp inflammation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mild asthma treated with inhalers; asymptomatic right bundle branch block on electrocardiography.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father and sister are also affected by similar hair loss and related symptoms: the father experienced hair loss beginning at age 27 years with associated photophobia, while the sister showed symptoms of facial redness and scalp issues beginning in early childhood.
